required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Phase 1/2 Study To Evaluate ASN002 In Relapsed/Refractory Lymphoma And Advanced Solid Tumors
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 1/2, Open-Label, Uncontrolled, Multiple Dose Escalation, Cohort Expansion Study To Evaluate The Safety, Tolerability, Pharmacokinetics And Preliminary Efficacy Of Asn002 In Relapsed/Refractory Lymphoma, Myelofibrosis, Chronic Lymphocytic Leukemia, And Advanced Solid Tumors

brief_summary.textblock: This study is a dose escalation, and cohort expansion study in subjects with advanced cancer for which no standard therapy exists. Subjects must have received prior treatment for cancer that has not worked, or has stopped working.

detailed_description.textblock: The study will be conducted in two parts. Part A is a dose escalation study to determine a safe and tolerable dose of ASN002 for subjects with relapsed or refractory lymphoma, or advanced solid tumors. Part A will also characterize the pharmacokinetics and pharmacodynamics of ASN002 through blood sampling. Subjects in Part B will enroll subjects with four types of lymphoma Diffuse Large B-cell Lymphoma (DLBCL), Follicular Lymphoma (FL), Mantle Cell Lymphoma (MCL) and Peripheral T-cell lymphoma (PTCL). Additional groups of subjects with Myelofibrosis (MF) and Chronic Lymphocytic Leukemia (CLL) will be enrolled. Subjects will be treated with the highest safe and tolerable dose determined in Part A of the study to determine preliminary efficacy. Subjects may continue to receive ASN002 for up to 1 year in the absence of severe side effects or disease progression.

primary_outcome.measure: Part A: Determine the maximum tolerated dose (MTD) of ASN002
primary_outcome.description: The MTD will be determined by evaluating the number of subjects with treatment related dose limiting toxicity. This is the primary endpoint of Part A

primary_outcome.measure: Part B: evaluate the overall response rate (number of Complete Responses + Partial Responses) in subjects receiving ASN002 for the treatment of lymphoma, MF and CLL.
primary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in the severity of disease, This is the primary endpoint for Part B.

secondary_outcome.measure: Calculate the pharmacokinetic area under the plasma concentration (AUC) of ASN002
secondary_outcome.description: Calculate the amount of ASN002 in the bloodstream

secondary_outcome.measure: Calculate the maximum plasma concentration (Cmax) at steady state.
secondary_outcome.description: Calculate the maximum amount of ASN002 in the bloodstream
Calculate how fast ASN002 leaves the body

other_outcome.measure: To evaluate the change from baseline in the intensity of Phospho-STAT3 protein found in the blood of patients with lymphoma.
other_outcome.description: Evaluate the effect of ASN002 on tumor biomarkers

other_outcome.measure: To evaluate the change from baseline in the intensity of Phospho-S6 protein found in the blood of patients with lymphoma.
other_outcome.description: Evaluate the effect of ASN002 on biomarkers

other_outcome.measure: To evaluate the change from baseline in the intensity of Phospho-spleen tyrosine kinase (SYK) 525/526 protein found in the blood of patients with lymphoma..
other_outcome.description: Evaluate the effect of ASN002 on biomarkers

other_outcome.measure: To evaluate the change from baseline in the intensity of Phospho-extracellular signal-regulated kinases (ERK) protein found in the blood of patients with lymphoma.
other_outcome.description: Evaluate the effect of ASN002 on biomarkers

other_outcome.measure: The number of patients who show a decrease from baseline in a serum panel of biomarkers of inflammation
other_outcome.description: Evaluate the effect of ASN002 on biomarkers

arm_group.description: Multiple ascending doses of ASN002 will be administered to determine the maximum tolerated dose (MTD). Arm Closed
ASN002 administered at the recommended dose in subjects with DLBCL. Arm Closed
ASN002 administered at the recommended dose in subjects with MCL. Arm Closed
ASN002 administered at the recommended dose in subjects with FL.
ASN002 administered at the recommended dose in subjects with PTCL.
ASN002 administered at the recommended dose in subjects with MF.
ASN002 administered at the recommended dose in subjects with CLL.

intervention.description: Multiple ascending doses of ASN002 assigned by cohort
Recommended dose of ASN002 from Part A
